edu.lehigh.cse.lol

Class LolCallback

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.lehigh.cse.lol.LolCallback
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public abstract class LolCallback
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    LolCallback provides an easy way to describe code that should run in response to special events, such as timers, screen presses, or collisions between actors. In the interest of simplicity, we use some public fields instead of getters and setters. This also lets us get away with using the default constructor.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Actor mAttachedActor
      For collision events or actor press events, this is the actor to which the callback is attached
      Actor mCollideActor
      For collision events, this is the other actor involved in the collision
      Vector3 mDownLocation
      When a callback runs in response to a screen touch, we may need to know the world coordinates of the down-press
      float mFloatVal
      A float that may be of use during the callback
      int mIntVal
      An integer that may be of use during the callback
      Vector3 mMoveLocation
      When a callback runs in response to a screen touch, we may need to know the world coordinates of the press as it moves.
      Vector3 mUpLocation
      When a callback runs in response to a screen touch, we may need to know the world coordinates of the up-press

      LolCallback clone()
      Make a copy of the current LolCallback
      abstract void onEvent()
      This code will run in response to the event for which the callback is registered
